TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit LabelEditEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the and events.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LabelEditEventArgs> specifies the index and caption of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> and the caption after it has been edited by the user. This class also provides a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LabelEditEventArgs.CancelEdit%2A> property. You can use this property in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.BeforeLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event handler to prevent the user from editing the label. You can also use it in an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AfterLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event handler to revert the change, returning the label it to its original value. This is useful when you want to validate user input before committing the change.
> [!NOTE] > Because the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AfterLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event takes place before the label edit is committed, calling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Sort%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method in a handler for this event will sort the item using the original value.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.BeforeLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event and using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LabelEditEventArgs.Item%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LabelEditEventArgs.CancelEdit%2A> properties. To run the example, paste the following code in a form containing a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control named `ListView1` and populated with at least 3 items. Ensure all events are associated with their event-handling methods.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView3#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView3/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView3#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView3/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.ListView3#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView3/VB/form1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this constructor when raising the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.BeforeLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AfterLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event at run time to specify a specific list item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> to edit.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use this constructor when raising the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.BeforeLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AfterLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event at run time to specify a list item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> to edit. The constructor also enables you to specify the new text associated with the label of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether changes made to the label of the should be canceled.
Docs.value: if the edit operation of the label for the should be canceled; otherwise .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this property to cancel changes made to the label of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> and revert it to its original text. Use this property to prevent an item's caption from being changed to a value that does not meet your application's requirements.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.BeforeLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event and using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LabelEditEventArgs.Item%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.LabelEditEventArgs.CancelEdit%2A> properties. To run the example, paste the following code in a form containing a ListView control named ListView1 and populated with at least 3 items. Ensure all events are associated with their event-handling methods.
[!code-cpp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView3#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView3/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.ListView3#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView3/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.ListView3#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.ListView3/VB/form1.vb#1)]

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AfterLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> named `ListView1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.AfterLabelEdit?displayProperty=fullName> event.
[!code-csharp[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#463](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/CS/EventExamples.cs#463)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#463](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples/VB/EventExamples.vb#463)]
